question.title: GraphStream nodes are not responding to mouse clicks (no event triggered)
question.body:
I'm building a Java Swing application using GraphStream to visualize cities as nodes in a graph. Each city has transport stations (bus/train), and when a user clicks a node (city), it should show a dialog with information about that city's stations.

However, the problem is: clicking on a node does absolutely nothing â€” no buttonPushed event is triggered, and nothing is printed to the console.


public class InteractiveMap extends JFrame implements ViewerListener {
    private Graph graph;
    private City[][] cityMatrix;
    private boolean loop = true;

    public InteractiveMap() {
        setTitle("Interactive City Map");
        setSize(800, 600);
        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.DISPOSE_ON_CLOSE);

        System.setProperty("org.graphstream.ui", "swing");
        initializeGraph();

        Viewer viewer = graph.display(false);
        ViewerPipe viewerPipe = viewer.newViewerPipe();
        viewerPipe.addViewerListener(this);
        viewerPipe.addSink(graph);

        new Thread(() -> {
            while (loop) {
                viewerPipe.pump();
                try {
                    Thread.sleep(25);
                } catch (InterruptedException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            }
        }).start();
    }

    private void initializeGraph() {
        graph = new SingleGraph("CityMap");
        graph.setStrict(false);
        graph.setAutoCreate(true);

        loadCityMatrix();

        for (int i = 0; i < cityMatrix.length; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < cityMatrix[0].length; j++) {
                String cityName = cityMatrix[i][j].getName();
                Node node = graph.addNode(cityName);
                node.setAttribute("ui.label", cityName);
                node.setAttribute("xyz", j * 8, -i * 8, 0);
                node.setAttribute("ui.style", "fill-color: #4FC3F7; size: 60px; shape: circle;");
            }
        }

        connectCities();
    }

    private void loadCityMatrix() {
        // Loads cities and their stations/departures from JSON (not shown for brevity)
    }

    private void connectCities() {
        for (int i = 0; i < cityMatrix.length; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < cityMatrix[0].length; j++) {
                City city = cityMatrix[i][j];
                for (City neighbor : city.getConnectedCities()) {
                    String from = city.getName();
                    String to = neighbor.getName();
                    String edgeId = from.compareTo(to) < 0 ? from + "-" + to : to + "-" + from;

                    if (graph.getEdge(edgeId) == null && !from.equals(to)) {
                        graph.addEdge(edgeId, from, to);
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }

    @Override
    public void buttonPushed(String id) {
        System.out.println("Clicked node: " + id);
        City city = findCityByName(id);
        if (city != null) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(this, "City clicked: " + city.getName());
        }
    }

    @Override
    public void buttonReleased(String id) {}

    @Override
    public void mouseLeft(String id) {}

    @Override
    public void mouseOver(String id) {}

    @Override
    public void viewClosed(String id) {
        loop = false;
    }

    private City findCityByName(String name) {
        for (int i = 0; i < cityMatrix.length; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < cityMatrix[0].length; j++) {
                if (cityMatrix[i][j].getName().equals(name)) {
                    return cityMatrix[i][j];
                }
            }
        }
        return null;
    }

}
